fears.utils.AutoRate module¶

class fears.utils.AutoRate.Experiment(folder_path, moat=False, replicate_arrangement='rows', drug_conc=None, units='ug/mL', data_cols=None, debug=False)¶

Bases: object

Experiment class for a given plate reader experiment

execute()¶

run the growth rate analyses

fit_hill_curve(xdata, ydata)¶

Fits dose-response curve to growth rate data

Parameters

  • xdata (list or numpy array) – drug concentration curve from plate experiment

  • ydata (list or numpy array) – growth rate versus drug concetration for a given replicate

Returns

List of optimized paramters: IC50, drugless growth rate, and Hill coefficient

Return type

list

gen_growth_rate_lib()¶

Generates the complete growth rate library by compining the growth rate libraries of each plate

Returns

growth rate library

Return type

dict

gen_seascape_lib()¶

Fits raw estimated growth rate values to a Hill dose-response curve

Parameters

  • pop (population class object, optional) – population class object. Defaults to None.

  • debug (bool, optional) – generates plots useful for debugging if true. Defaults to False.

Raises

ValueError – raises error if there is no growth rate library in the experiment object

Returns

seascape library

Return type

dict

  • IC50 (float)) – IC50

  • g_drugless (float) – drugless growth rate

  • hill_coeff (float) – Hill coefficient

Bases: object

96-well plate object

check_if_key_is_well(key)¶
Checks if key could refer to a well (i.e. key is in format ‘X##’ where X is a letter and # are numbers)

For instance, returns True is key is ‘A11’, returns False if key is ‘Time (s)’

Parameters

str (key) – key to check

Returns

True if key could refer to a well, False if other.

Return type

boolean

est_growth_rate(growth_curve, t=None, carrying_cap=4)¶

Estimates growth rate from OD growth curve

Parameters

  • growth_curve (list or numpy array) – vector of OD data

  • t (list or numpy array, optional) – Time vector. If None, algorithm assumes each time step is 1 s. Defaults to None.

Returns

Growth rate in units of 1/s

Return type

float

fears.utils.fitness module¶

fears.utils.fitness.est_mic(pop, gen, Kmic=None, growth_rate=None)¶

est_mic: estimates the mic based on a given Kmic (ratio of growth rate to max growth rate at MIC) or based on a given growth rate.

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) –

  • gen (int) – Genotype under consideration.

  • Kmic (float, optional) – Ratio of growth rate to max growth rate at MIC. The default is None.

  • growth_rate (float, optional) – Growth rate at MIC. The default is None.

Raises

Exception – Function requires Kmic OR growth_rate to calculate MIC.

Returns

mic – MIC at a given growth rate or Kmic.

Return type

float

fears.utils.fitness.fit_logistic_curve(xdata, ydata)¶
fears.utils.fitness.gen_digital_seascape(pop, conc, gen, min_fitness=0.0)¶
Boostraps a ‘digital seascape’ from the continuous population seascape

and computes the fitness at a given concentration.

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – Population object

  • conc (flaot) – concentration at which to compute fitness

  • gen (int) – genotype of interest

  • min_fitness (float, optional) – Minimum fitness at conc higher than MIC. Defaults to 0.

Returns

growth rate (fitness)

Return type

float

fears.utils.fitness.gen_fit_land(pop, conc, mode=None, **kwargs)¶

Generates the fitness landscape at a given drug concentration

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – Population object

  • conc (float) – drug concentration

  • counts (array-like) – list of population counts

Returns

lits of growth rates

Return type

list

fears.utils.fitness.gen_fitness(pop, genotype, conc, drugless_rate=None, ic50=None, hc=None)¶

Computes the fitness of a genotype at a given drug concentration.

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – Population object containing data of interest

  • genotype (int) – Genotype of interest

  • conc (float) – drug concentration of interest

  • drugless_rate (float, optional) – Drugless growth rate. If None, data is retrieved from population object. Defaults to None.

  • ic50 (float, optional) – Genotype-specific IC50. If None, data is retrived from population object. Defaults to None.

  • hc (float, optional) – Hill coefficient. If None, data is retrived from population object. Defaults to None.

Returns

Growth rate computed from pharmacodynamic equation.

Return type

float

fears.utils.fitness.gen_fitness_curves(pop, conc=None)¶

Generates a dict of dose-response curves for a given population.

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – Population object

  • conc (array-like, optional) – Array of concentrations to generate fitness for.

  • None (If) –

  • np.logspace (generates a list of using) –

Returns

dict of dose-reponse curves. Each entry in the dict represents a genotype-specific dose response curve.

Return type

dict

fears.utils.fitness.gen_fl_for_abm(pop, conc, counts)¶

Same as gen_fit_land but also scales by carrying capacity

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – Population object

  • conc (float) – drug concentration

  • counts (array-like) – list of population counts

Returns

lits of growth rates

Return type

list

fears.utils.fitness.gen_null_seascape(pop, conc, method='curve_fit')¶
Generates a ‘null seascape’.

Methods: curve_fit: fits a new set of random curves to the range of the natural population seascape. sort: sorts IC50 values to match rank-order of pop drugless_rates

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – Population object

  • conc (float) – drug concentration at which to retrieve null seascape rank order

  • method (str, optional) – Null seascape method. Defaults to ‘curve_fit’.

Returns

list of drugless growth rates and IC50s.

Return type

list

fears.utils.fitness.gen_random_seascape(pop, n_allele=None, drugless_limits=None, ic50_limits=None)¶

Generates random seascape data

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – Population object

  • n_allele (int, optional) – Number of alleles. If None, gets data from pop. Defaults to None.

  • drugless_limits (list, optional) – Range of drugless growth rates to generate random data from. If None, gets data from pop. Defaults to None.

  • ic50_limits (list, optional) – Range of IC50 to generate random data from. If None, gets data from pop. Defaults to None.

Returns

list of drugless growth rates and IC50s.

Return type

list

fears.utils.fitness.gen_static_landscape(pop, conc)¶

Generates a growth rate fitness landscape at a given drug concentration

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – Population object

  • conc (float) – drug concentration at which to generate fitness landscape

Returns

list of growth rates

Return type

list

fears.utils.fitness.logistic_equation(conc, drugless_rate, ic50)¶

Logistic equation from ogbunugafor et al, PLOS CB, 2016

Parameters

  • dugless_rate (float) – Drugless growth rate of genotype.

  • ic50 (float) – ic50 of genotype.

  • conc (float) – Drug concentration (in Molarity (M)).

  • c (float, optional) – Logistic curve steepness parameter. The default is -0.6824968.

Returns

f – Replication rate.

Return type

float

fears.utils.fitness.logistic_pharm_curve(x, IC50, g_drugless, hill_coeff)¶

Logistic dose-response curve. use if input is a single drug concentration

Parameters

  • x (float) – drug concentration scalar

  • IC50 (float)) – IC50

  • g_drugless (float) – drugless growth rate

  • hill_coeff (float) – Hill coefficient

Returns

array of growth rates

Return type

numpy array

fears.utils.fitness.scale_and_ignore_zeros(data, target)¶

Scale data to range of target while ignoring the zero values in data and target.

Parameters

  • data (numpy array) – Data to be scaled to the range of target.

  • target (numpy array) – Target data range.

Returns

scaled_data – Scaled data to range of target. Zero values in data are set to zero in scaled_data and zero values in target are not used to calculate range.

Return type

numpy array

fears.utils.fitness.sl_to_fitness(pop, g, conc, hc=None)¶

Seascape library to fitness value (in units per second)

Parameters

  • pop (population class object) – population class object

  • g (int) – genotype

  • conc (float) – drug concentration

Returns

fitness

Return type

float

fears.utils.plotter module¶

fears.utils.plotter.add_landscape_to_fitness_curve(c, ax, pop, textcolor='gray', colorbar=False, square=True, vert_lines=True, position='top', pad=0, vert_lines_ydata=None, **kwargs)¶
fears.utils.plotter.gen_color_cycler(style=None, palette='bright', n_colors=16)¶
fears.utils.plotter.get_msw(wt_fitness_curve, cur_fitness_curve, conc)¶
fears.utils.plotter.get_pos_in_log_space(center, width)¶

Returns x or y coordinates to pass to inset_axes when the axis is a log scale in order to make the inset axes uniform sizes.

Parameters

  • center (float) – Center point of the axes in data points (not log-ed).

  • width (float) – Visual width of the axes (in log units).

Returns

x – x[0] = left point, x[1] = right point. log10(x[1]-x[0]) = width

Return type

list of floats

fears.utils.plotter.msw_grid(pop, genotypes, ax=None, legend=True, labelsize=10, ticklabelsize=10, comp_annotate_pos=3.9810717055349695e-05, legendloc='best')¶
fears.utils.plotter.plot_fitness_curves(pop, fig_title='', plot_r0=False, save=False, savename=None, fig=None, ax=None, labelsize=15, linewidth=3, show_legend=True, show_axes_labels=True, raw_data=False, color_kwargs={})¶
fears.utils.plotter.plot_kaplan_meier(pop, event_times, label=None, t_max=None, n_sims=None, ax=None, mode='resistant', errorband=True, **kwargs)¶
fears.utils.plotter.plot_landscape(p, conc=1, fit_land=None, relative=True, rank=True, ax=None, ignore_zero=False, colorbar_lim=None, colorbar=True, node_size=800, textsize=11, resize_param=0.2, square=False, textcolor='black', cbax=None, cblabel='', cbloc=[0.1, 0.8, 0.3, 0.5], network_only=False, edge_color='gray', plot_sub_network=False, sub_network=None, sub_network_color='white', **kwargs)¶

Plots a graph representation of this landscape on the current matplotlib figure. If p is set to a vector of occupation probabilities, the edges in the graph will have thickness proportional to the transition probability between nodes.

fears.utils.plotter.plot_msw(pop, wt, conc=None, fc=None, ncols=2, figsize=(2.5, 8))¶

plot_msw: method for plotting mutant selection window figures.

Parameters

  • pop (population_class object) –

  • fitness_curves (numpy array) – Columns 1-N represents a genotype that is a neighbor of column 0 (ancestor). Rows represent drug concentration.

  • conc (numpy array) – Drug concentration used to calculate fitness_curves

  • genotypes (list of ints) – Genotypes that were used to calculate the fitness_curves.

  • save (bool) –

Returns

fig – MSW figures

Return type

figure object

fears.utils.plotter.plot_population_count(pop, c, ax=None, thresh=None, normalize=False, max_cells=None, logscale=True, **kwargs)¶
fears.utils.plotter.plot_timecourse(pop, counts_t=None, title_t=None, **kwargs)¶
fears.utils.plotter.plot_timecourse_to_axes(pop, counts, counts_ax, drug_curve=None, drug_curve_label='Drug Concentration \n($μ$M)', drug_curve_legend_label=None, drug_ax_sci_notation=False, drug_ax=None, labelsize=15, linewidth=3, legend_labels=True, label_lines=False, select_labels=None, label_xpos=None, grayscale=False, legend_size=8, color_kwargs={}, drug_kwargs={}, label_kwargs={}, **kwargs)¶

Plots simulation timecourse to user defined axes (counts_ax).

Parameters

  • pop (Population class object) – Population class object containing population visualization options.

  • counts (numpy array) – Simulation data to be plotted.

  • counts_ax (matplotlib axes object) – Axes on which data is plotted.

  • drug_curve (numpy array, optional) – Optional drug concentration curve to plot. Requires additional drug axes. The default is None.

  • drug_ax (matplotlib axes, optional) – Axes on which drug curve is plotted. The default is None.

  • labelsize (float, optional) – Font size of the labels. The default is 15.

  • linewidth (float, optional) – Width parameter passed to matplotlib plot function. The default is 3.

Raises

Exception – Error given if no drug axes are provided but the drug curve is not None (drug data needs drug axes to plot to).

Returns

  • counts_ax (matplotlib axes) – Axes with counts data plotted.

  • drug_ax (matplotlib axes) – Axes with drug curve data plotted.

Parameters

  • ax (matplotlib axes) – axes whose position is shifted

  • pad (float) – shift amount

Returns

ax – shifted axes

Return type

fears.utils.stats module¶

fears.utils.stats.km_curve(exp=None, exp_info_path=None, resistance_outcome=[14, 15])¶
Returns a dictionary of dictionaries of K-M curves from the

given experiment. Each experimental condition has two resistance curves (defined by resistance_outcome) and a survival curve.

Parameters

  • exp (fears Experiment object, optional) – Experiment to analyze. Defaults to None.

  • exp_info_path (str, optional) – Optional path to Experiment object. Defaults to None.

  • resistance_outcome (list, optional) – List of resistance outcomes. Defaults to [14,15].

Returns

Dict of dicts containing KM curves. Sub-dictionaries are different experimental conditions.

Return type

dict
